data.title: Class (Computer Programming)
data.meta_description:
Ruby - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document provides an overview of the Ruby programming language, including its history, key features, versions, and design philosophy. Some of the main points covered are:

- Ruby is a dynamic, interpreted object-oriented language created in the 1990s by Yukihiro Matsumoto that emphasizes programmer productivity. 
- It supports multiple programming paradigms like procedural, object-oriented, and functional programming.
- Major versions include Ruby 1.8, 1.9, 2.0, 3.0 and beyond, with each release adding new features and improvements.
- The creator designed Ruby to be fun and productive for programmers, following good principles of user interface design.
